Reviews.Title: “We thought it was perfect . . .”
Reviews.Author: nyimagery2010
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure about this one based on previous reviews, but the charming exterior in the photo won me over and I gave it a chance. I was totally pleased with the staff and the room. Spoke with several of the staff at various times with questions and asking directions and they were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean, well cared for and totally adequate for my needs. The location was great - a short walk from anything you could want, super easy access to and from the main highway. I couldn't have been happier with this choice of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe, decrepit”
Reviews.Author: NfldTravellers
Reviews.Content: Terrible, run down old house that should be condemned. Long red bugs all over the room, unfinished and mouldy walls, electrical problems where you can't plug in two things at once, a TV and phone from 1972, no possibility of internet, three floor of old stairs, fire escape door open all the time....We really felt unsafe and were forced to leave and find somewhere else to stay. When we talked to the owner, he said he would move us to a different room (since they were empty - I wonder why?!). But there was nothing in this place that was fit to move to so we got a $100 lesson! Just remember - when the price is too good to be true, it usually is. I would not suggest anyone stay here.

Reviews.Title: “small - central located, fits the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: Kathrin80
Reviews.Content: We did arrive in Montreal without a place and then looked through a search engine for a relative cheaper place (EUR 80), still centrally located. the hotel comes accross rather old and a bit run down. its located at a main street, but our room was on the side and we looked toward parking. the room was very small and we had a king size to share (1,40m) for 2 people. here was not much room to move around. air condition was with cables hanging down and a warning to not use airco and hair dryer at the same time. breakfast was simple and in the basement. there was an extra fee for parking at a neighboured parking place.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome crash pad”
Reviews.Author: nau_wat
Reviews.Content: The guy that checked us in was awesome!!!!! Aside from that, it's a great place for what it is. It's across the street from the bell center and a 5 minutes from down town. It's a great place to crash, and it's really cheap, which is perfect for a few broke college students.

Reviews.Title: “BED-BUGS STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: snowball94
Reviews.Content: STAY AWAY! They have bedbugs and eventhough the cleaning lady found a living bedbug and we didn't have to pay for our room, they don't want to admit it afterwards. We got bitten all over and now our house is infected and we need to have the pest control to spray the whole building! Wish I never booked a room there, it is horrible!

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs and ripoffs and crime, oh my!”
Reviews.Author: dalofsin
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel, even for just a moment (as we checked out and took the loss almost as quickly as we checked in), has left me with an all time low in regards to the service industry. A list will do just fine. 1) The woman at the front desk was awful. Rude and unwilling to accommodate. And the guy was no better. 2) We were told immediately to remove any valuables or GPS from our car, because it would be broken into, not that it MIGHT be broken in....that it WOULD BE! 3) The pictures online make the rooms look bigger than microscopic, which is a lie. There was 1 foot between the 2 beds, the floors are tile, and my neck turned red and got itchy within 10 minutes of being there. 4) The AC window unit was busted through the wall and held in place with tape. 5) The rooms are so old that they still use standard keys 6) They serve breakfast in a basement (didnt stay long enough to experience this) 7) The rates are the same as the Holiday Inn 2 blocks away, in a better neighborhood, and with rooms 100 times better. 8) Ever person we mentioned the hotel to for the rest of the weekend made itching gestures and laughed and said they would never stay there. The locals know best!! On a weekend booked solid for a music festival, we were willing to pay 5 times as much NOT to stay at this hotel. It was the worst I have ever seen, and I would not wish it upon my worst enemy. I would sooner recommend staying in the $12 indoor parking garage around the corner and sleeping in your car. PLEASE....Hotels.com....remove this listing and do not risk the bad press....we complained and were able to receive a full refund for 2 nights for 3 rooms from hotels.com. Thank you for doing right by us....but don't put your customers in this position ever again!

Reviews.Title: “A real bargain downtown”
Reviews.Author: ahl899
Reviews.Content: Reading the other reviews, I can't figure out what people are expecting for accommodations 1/2 the price of other hotels in the downtown Montreal area. Our room was small although charming and clean, with A/C and TV that worked fine. It is steps from the metro, on the edge of downtown in a quiet but safe area. It was a restful and convenient stay. Again, if people are expecting 3 or 4 star quality, they should choose to pay for it! This place is a real gem and bargain.

Reviews.Title: “If you want cheap and kinda clean, steps from the Bell Centre, this is the place.”
Reviews.Author: loopygurl
Reviews.Content: It is definitely cheap and located in a great area. Just steps from the Bell Centre, many bars and night clubs, shopping, and restaurants....BUT, It isn't the most comfortable of places. My husband and I recently went up for the UFC and managed the get in a hockey game. We love Montreal and usually stay with friends, but they hand relatives staying with them this time.... Location ***** Price ** spend a couple extra bucks and stay somewhere nice Cleanliness * Size of Room - broom closet Atmosphere - none Quality of Room * I am no princess by any means, but this place was pretty nasty. Blankets on bed made me afraid. Stand up shower like someone might have at a cottage, no room to turn around, raise your arms, and if you drop anything you will have to get out to pick it up. Everything seems to be miniature in the room as well. Air conditioner seems to be held to the wall with duct tape. Everything is old and grungie. They do seem to be cleaning constantly, but whatever they are cleaning with has an overwhelming smell, like something bad has happening there and they are tying to cover up the stench. Breakfast is coffee and toast. If it's the guys heading up for a game or something and you are planning on being drunk for you stay, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Stay- Bedbugs, rude service and tiny”
Reviews.Author: SSevent
Reviews.Content: We did not enjoy our stay here at all. Our room was switched before we even got to the hotel, then our room had bed bugs. We were switched to a tiny room in the basement with bars on the windows and cold tile floors. We ended up sleeping in another hotel with friends for the night, and got a refund for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly nice little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mrsdeb
Reviews.Content: If this hotel was any closer to the Bell Centre, it would have been inside the doors! The receptionist and cafe attendant were very pleasant and helpful; the room was tiny, but clean, and very reasonable; the parking lot was close and spacious (an extra $12cdn+tax). No, it wasn't luxurious. Still, it was a perfectly nice little hotel, and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “so, so”
Reviews.Author: caramel0
Reviews.Content: It is a place to go not for pleasure. Small, not too comfortable but close to everything. Seems to be clean, even thou some soap left in the sink. Nice breakfast: coffee, croissant, tea, fruit spread (was the best), butter, toast, orange juice. Not too friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to crash - don't expect much”
Reviews.Author: CC080808
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my boyfriend after a concert at the Bell Centre. It's basically a good place to crash after a night of partying. ROOM: The room was small and not fashionable decorated but seemed clean. The TV remote worked but we had to pay a deposit to use it. Bathroom was tiny. There was soap left in the sink from the previous guest. SERVICE: Interacted with 3 people (2 receptionists, 1 cleaning person) and none were friendly. Gawked at you for asking for any service. SECURITY: You receive 2 keys - one for the room and one for the front door, which is locked after 11 pm. The front door key did not work and we had to enter through the back door, which was wide open. I'm surprised there aren't homeless people sleeping in the common areas. The next day, the receptionist was adamant that the key should have worked. PARKING: Paid $13.50, even though website says $11.

Reviews.Title: “Sketchy”
Reviews.Author: stevo_b27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights (April 15- April 20, 2009). Four of us had two rooms. In both rooms rooms the tv remotes didnt work and the staff didn't seem to care, one tv only had 5 channels the other tv had a nice few. You almost have to stand on the tiolett to close the bathroom door, shower has barely enough room to turn around. rooms very dusty with spider webs in corners, no ice machine or A/C, and pretty much no lobby. Besides not caring about the remotes, most staff were friendly in giving info about the city, and the location is great. Good spot to stay for a bunch of guys out for an event at the bell center or to party, DEFINETLY not a place to take your wife or family.

Reviews.Title: “Very Interesting Stay”
Reviews.Author: akyiba
Reviews.Content: Well when we arrived there was glass on the ground from car break-ins. There were break-ins during our stay. We parked where the staff told us to park so that may have helped with our car not being broken into. We were on a floor with loud college students. I think it was the size of the rooms that made it seem that they were louder than they really were. The most exciting part during our stay there was a police scene right under our window. Apparently one of the guest at this hotel car was broken into and he saw it happening and called the police. That was interesting to watch. This place does have a continental breakfast which I cannot complain about at all. The croissants were delish with a nice glass of orange juice to wash it down. I found the staff to be very helpful and we were able to exchange our money there.

Reviews.Title: “beware!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: czartoronto
Reviews.Content: To everybody B E W A R E of this Hotel du Nouveau Forum Montreal. This place is not the place for you guys to book,check-in or stay. The receptionist is not so very helpful ( the chinese guy with a long hair ), the rooms so very very small and the washroom so tiny, not so spacious and it needs to share to the other room next to you. About the floor carpet dusty, dirty and so cleaned, the same also with the bedsheet so smelly. This place is disgusting and very uncomfortable to stay...B E W A R E !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for the Hockey Traveler”
Reviews.Author: hockeyguru24
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel for the price. Room was small but quaint. TV remote control didn't work. Breakfast is Bread and coffee or juice only.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: peterklug
Reviews.Content: Will never stay there again. Rooms are dirty. Forget about "ensuite" bathrooms - although repainted they stink and the paint is peeling off. Sink full of rust. Breakfast tables are dirty, you need a paper towel to wipe them off first. Parking is included, walking distance to downtown (probably the only good thing). Will never stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “CHEAP AND CLOSE TO EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: ms_turee
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 2 times...once for new years in 2006 and then may24 weekend last year...if ur a teenager and dont want to spend a lot of money on a hotel i highly recommend this..rooms are tiny and feel crowded..and washrooms are tinnnnnnnnnnyyy..but if ur not planning on staying in the hotel long and are just using it to sleep then book this,,..cheapest place in downtown montreal..and literally a 5 min walk to clubs and party scene.Two of my friends got bug bites...thats the only problem and there's no kicthen or anything...and security wise anyone can basically walk in and out..good for sneaking in..but not good for rapists and such.,.friendly staff...and never got noise complaints...basically threw a party in the hallway on the 3rd floor and did beer bongs and no one came up stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Had 2 great stays there”
Reviews.Author: Mathieu B
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised to read many bad reviews of this place. I've stayed there twice when I used to live in Quebec City and had to sleep in Mtl. Both times I was very satisfied. First, the rates are very cheap for a place this close to Downtown. Especially convenient if you attend a show or a hockey game at the Bell Centre right accross the street. The staff was real friendly and helpful. The rooms were a bit small but very clean, including the bathroom. Beds were confortable, TV worked fine. Breakfast was excellent. I remember having a pleasant conversation with the employee on duty. She was real friendly, asking what I was in town for, if I slept well even though they had many guest that night who attended the Motley Crue show (!). (Fact is I slept perfectly, didn't really hear any noise). The only thing I can think of, is that this place went suddenly through a downward spiral in 2 years. That'd be sad, because it had a great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “The second worst hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: UgaChaka
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for the victoria day holiday in may, I couldn't wait to get out of there. There were a few things that made this place intollerable: 1. There were stains on the toilet seat (i tried to wipe them off with a tissue, it didn't work). It was the first hotel that I actually had to pad the toilet sit. 2. Extremely smelly AC - although it was extremely hot and the window in the room didn't open we had to turn the AC off. 3. "Continental breakfast" - I think these people read about hotels in some magazine. Their idea of continental breakfast is an extremely stale microwave heated croissante (limited one per person). 4. The shower was not in the same room as the toilet. The shower is just a nook in the wall right beside the front door so when you enter your room you see a shower curtain on your left (no door). Just don't go there.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has a bedbug epidemic!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AA-in-Boston
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY AT THE HOTEL DU NOUVEAU FORUM!!!!!! My husband and I stayed there last weekend and woke up with bugs in the bed. We did not think much of it, just that it was disgusting, and we returned to the states. One week later we are COVERED in red blistery bug bites. I have over 100 on my body. I went to the Doctor and he told me that they were bedbug bites and that they take up to 7 days to erupt out of your skin and then will continue to blister for up to 9 more days. They are horrible and painful and feverish. You can contract Hepatitis B from the bites. I have contacted the hotel, the Canadian Dept. of Heath AND the Montreal tourism board, but I want to make as many people aware of this problem as possible. The hotel itself did not seem dirty or anything, so CHECK YOUR MATRESSES wherever you stay. I do not want anyone else to suffer as we are. It is horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Nouveau Forum is a good hotel for a great price. It is very basic, but that is fine with me, since I don't spend much time in my hotel when on vacation. The rooms were basic, clean, and a decent size, and the hotel was quiet. Free continental breakfast (coffe, tea, juice, toast, croissants) are included, and for $1 more you can order bagels or cereal. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The area isn't the prettiest (near a parking lot and the entrance to the highway) but it is safe and close to lots of activities. It is within walking distance to downtown. If you like to walk, it is about 20-30 minutes to Old Montreal. Or, you can take the metro; the nearest station is just a block away. If you are looking for a hotel with lots of amenities and with great views, this is not the hotel for you. But if you are looking for a safe, clean place at a bargain price, check out the Hotel du Nouveau Forum.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, but is it worth it ?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite small, and the rooms are even smaller. There is just room for the bed, and that is it. We stayed at the hotel because it was a great price, and the location is excellent (30 second walk to the Bell Centre). However, I would not stay there again. The service is horrendous. The maid did not clean our room because we did not leave a tip in advance. The "continental breakfast" consists of toasts and butter. The rooms are quite dirty and it was a rather scary experience. My word of advice is spend a little more, and stay somewhere else, it will be worth it.
